Description: Fragment of an undyed linen plain weave on which a large tapestry square has been applied and sewn (21x22.5cm); centre of the square is decorated with a bird in purple with wing details in beige, the two legs and the beak are in pink/red wool, the head is missing; the bird is surrounded with a freize of purple Greek vases, from which two purple leaves are springing out; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/18), weft-undyed linen (S11); tapestry on single threads: undyed wool? (S/12), weft-undyed linen (S/38), purple wool (S/80), pink and red wool (S spun Z plied together); flying threads:undyed linen (S); sewing: undyed linen (S spun Z ply); all edges are cut
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
